channel.title: performance on Roy Tang
channel.description: Recent content in performance on Roy Tang

item.title: Reply to 'Python execution speed: laptop vs desktop' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3939912/python-execution-speed-laptop-vs-desktop:
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
Reply to 'Python execution speed: laptop vs desktop' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3939912/python-execution-speed-laptop-vs-desktop:

Split your processing into multiple threads. Your particular i7 should be able to support up to 8 threads in parallel.

item.title: Reply to 'comparing two cursors in oracle instead of using MINUS' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2496360/comparing-two-cursors-in-oracle-instead-of-using-minus:
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
Reply to 'comparing two cursors in oracle instead of using MINUS' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2496360/comparing-two-cursors-in-oracle-instead-of-using-minus:

MINUS is the same as saying “get all the rows of the first query, then from that set remove the rows that are also in the second query”, so you could like load the results from the first query into an array in-memory, then loop through the second query results and check them one-by-one against the first query results and remove them if they exist.

I’m not sure that will actually perform better though (depends on a lot of things). You might also want to consider using NOT EXISTS instead and check that performance, i.e.

SELECT  RTRIM(LTRIM(A.HEAD)),
  A.EFFECTIVE_DATE,
FROM   TABLE_1 A
WHERE  A.TYPE_OF_ACTION='6'
AND    A.EFFECTIVE_DATE >= ADD_MONTHS(SYSDATE,-15)  
AND NOT EXISTS (
  SELECT 1 fFROM TABLE_2 B
  WHERE RTRIM(LTRIM(A.HEAD)) = RTRIM(LTRIM(B.HEAD))
  AND A.EFFECTIVE_DATE = B.EFFECTIVE_DATE
)

Some functional indexing may also be needed on RTRIM(LTRIM(A.HEAD))
